item.title: The A.I. Prompt That Could End the World
item.description: A destructive A.I., like a nuclear bomb, is now a concrete possibility; the question is whether anyone will be reckless enough to build one.

item.title: The Tom Homan Affair Has More Red Flags Than a May Day Parade
item.description: An apparent cash handoff is yet another star in the Trump administration’s constellation of ethics problems.

item.title: A One-Side Peace Plan Still Gives Palestinians Hope
item.description: A deal offers some possibility of a broader solution, but the hurdles are enormous.

item.title: Radosław Sikorski: Putin Is Escalating His War
item.description: The leadership of Russia must understand that its attempt to rebuild Europe’s last empire is doomed to fail.

item.title: Trump Is Taking the Nixon ‘Enemies List’ a Step Further
item.description: Nixon famously had an enemies list. But there’s a difference between what happened then and what is happening now.

item.title: Trump 2.0 Is America’s Worst Moments Redux
item.description: Remember when Republicans loved states’ rights?

item.title: Trump Disgraces American Justice
item.description: America is now in a dangerous period, in which the president can order investigations and indictments against his enemies.

item.title: 3 Writers Try to Make Sense of the Government Shutdown
item.description: What the polling says, who’s up, who’s down — and when it might end.

item.title: Trump’s ‘Compact’ With Universities Is Badly Needed
item.description: The government should not use public funds to support a system that fails to serve the public good.

item.title: A Worthy Nobel Peace Laureate
item.description: And a reminder of the need to depose the regime of Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: We Need to Ban Nonstick Pans
item.description: America will be better off without nonstick pans: healthier, safer and perhaps even more skilled at cooking.

item.title: Hope and Anxiety Over Israel-Gaza Peace
item.description: Readers respond to the rapidly developing events in the Middle East. Also: The virtues of coal; three hours with Velázquez.

item.title: Should We Call It the Roberts Court or the Trump Court?
item.description: A pivotal term beckons.

item.title: Cameroon Is in Thrall to a 92-Year-Old Man
item.description: Cameroon is in thrall to Paul Biya.

item.title: The Constitution Doesn’t Belong to Trump or the Supreme Court
item.description: It belongs to us. And we can use it to rescue our democracy.

item.title: Give Trump the Nobel for Gaza, if He Does the Harder Parts to Come
item.description: It’s a job that will take the rest of his presidency.

item.title: ICE May Not Be a Secret Police, but They Sure Look Like One
item.description: Authoritarian creep reaches a new phase.

item.title: I Love Watching Yankees Fans Suffer
item.description: I’m a dyed-in-the-wool New Yorker. But I can’t help rooting against the Yankees.

item.title: These Are the 10 Old Television Series Every Kid Needs to Watch
item.description: Here’s the list of ancient shows I inflict on my daughters. What’s yours?

item.title: He Believes America Should Be a Theocracy. He Says His Influence Is Growing.
item.description: Doug Wilson’s political project to “stop making God angry.”

item.title: Democrats Are Increasing Inequality
item.description: When it comes to education policy, Republicans are now kicking Democrats in the butt.

item.title: An Invitation to President Trump: Come to Gaza
item.description: Promises of peace between Jews and Palestinians must be turned into reality.

item.title: A Skeptical Reception for Hegseth’s Quantico Talk
item.description: Readers respond to a guest essay that put Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s speech in a more favorable light.

item.title: Is America Making God Angry?
item.description: Do Americans need to repent for their sins? In this episode of “Interesting Times,” the evangelical pastor Doug Wilson tells Ross Douthat why he believes Christian nationalism is the solution to societal decay and Americans need to “stop making God angry.”

item.title: Insults in the Name of God
item.description: The Christian nationalist Doug Wilson says he isn’t trying to be Howard Stern but his language can be just as controversial. On this week’s “Interesting Times,” he defends his use of “naughty words” as weapons in his arsenal.

item.title: What Israel Should Learn From Two Years of War
item.description: The only viable path to a Palestinian state is an end to the fantasy of Israel’s destruction.

item.title: The Trump Bump on Your Energy Bills
item.description: The president is going after clean energy, and Americans will face higher bills as a result.

item.title: It’s Getting Harder for Kids to Find Places to Play
item.description: Public parks are vital for children’s health.

item.title: The ‘Irony’ of the Government Shutdown
item.description: Health care premiums are expected to double for millions of Americans on Obamacare next year if the law doesn’t change in time. Neera Tanden walks Ezra Klein through the policy stakes of the government shutdown.

item.title: The G.O.P.’s ‘Cynical, Ridiculous’ Shutdown Attack
item.description: Health care premiums are expected to double for millions of Americans on Obamacare next year if the law doesn’t change in time. Neera Tanden walks Ezra Klein through the policy stakes of the government shutdown.

item.title: Parents, Doctors and Vaccines for Children
item.description: Readers respond to a guest essay about vaccine debates. Also: Attorney General Pam Bondi’s performance; wildfire smoke and our health.

item.title: Trump Is Not Afraid of Civil War. Neither Is Stephen Miller.
item.description: After all, there is “an enemy within.”

item.title: His Execution Is Days Away. A Detective Says He’s Innocent.
item.description: What happens when the science that sends a man to death row is debunked? Robert Roberson spent over 20 years on death row for his daughter’s death, but new evidence points to a different cause. Without intervention from Gov. Greg Abbott of Texas, Roberson’s execution is scheduled for Oct. 16.

item.title: What Civil Society Can Do to Beat Trumpism
item.description: People and institutions of civil society must coordinate against him.

item.title: Trump Is Doing a Good Thing for Lab Animals
item.description: Under Trump, the N.I.H. is encouraging alternatives that use human cells rather than dogs, cats and monkeys.

item.title: Tom Friedman on the Only Way to Solve the Israel-Hamas War
item.description: Can Donald Trump end the “worst war” with the latest round of peace talks?

item.title: What the Shutdown Is Really About
item.description: Obamacare premiums could double for millions of Americans if the law isn’t changed. Neera Tanden walks Ezra Klein through the shutdown’s policy stakes.

item.title: Trump’s Coal Plan Is Doomed
item.description: Domestic coal can’t compete with batteries, solar and gas much longer.

item.title: An Ideological Revolution Needs 12 Years in Power
item.description: The Trump administration has a long way to go.

item.title: Rewriting the Rules of the College Admissions ‘Game’
item.description: Readers respond to a guest essay about the broken process of college admissions. Also: What Taylor Swift taught us.

item.title: Israel Cannot Go On Winning Like This
item.description: Until the recent U.S.-backed peace deal, Israel has continued to use force without engaging in any viable diplomacy. It must change to save itself.

item.title: The Right’s Civil War Over Who Really Killed Charlie Kirk
item.description: MAGA is tearing itself apart over who really killed Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Mamdani’s Charm Offensive and Crash Course in How to Govern
item.description: Being mayor of New York City is one of the toughest jobs in politics. One glimpse of how Zohran Mamdani may seek to do it is whom he’s talking to.

item.title: No, Trump Can’t Order Troops to Wherever He Wants
item.description: The president’s claims about cities don’t hold up.

item.title: Why Democrats Aren’t Fighters
item.description: Democrats aren’t selecting the right fighters for the moment, says New York Times Opinion columnist Jamelle Bouie. Bouie, along with the columnists Michelle Goldberg and David French, debate how the Democrats are handling the shutdown on “The Opinions” latest round table.

item.title: That Hegseth Speech on D.E.I. in the Military Was Actually Pretty Good
item.description: Despite some rude provocations, he outlined a nuanced vision of the military.

item.title: Are Your Energy Costs Rising?
item.description: Share your energy bills for a forthcoming project about the demand of A.I. on the grid.
